phrases: Right knee pain after slipping and falling, feeling a pop, swelling, and pain during flexion/extension.
Accidental slip and fall on property a week ago caused knee issues.
Pain score 4/5 during mobility, minimal pain when stationary.
Pain to palpation of the medial knee, limited flexion/extension, edema, and effusion noted.
X-ray shows no fractures or bony abnormalities.
Diagnosed with medial collateral ligament (MCL) strain.
Prescribed ibuprofen 800 mg twice daily, knee brace, icing (20 mins, 3-4x/day), and elevation/rest for 2-3 weeks.
Continuing lisinopril 20 mg daily; diet non-compliant, referred to nutritionist for sodium intake reduction.
Grade 2/6 systolic ejection murmur heard on heart exam (pre-existing).
Avoid strenuous activity; family assistance advised for yard work.
